title.narrative: MICRONUTRIENT DEFICIENCIES

description.narrative: Extend technical assistance and guidance to MoHS in the development of the anaemia reduction strategy, including development of anemia reduction counselling tools and national vitamin A supplementation strategy, which contributes to Micronutrients, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of nutritional and care services by communities with a special focus on nutritionally-at-risk children and women residing in the hard to reach areas by end of December 2018

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Extend technical assistance and guidance to MoHS in the development of the anaemia reduction strategy, including development ofanemia reduction counselling tools and national vitamin A supplementation strategy

description.narrative: Within four-months of pilot implementation of a range of sustainable strategies to improve routine vitamin A supplementation (VAS) in three districts directly supported by UNICEF, VAS routine coverage increased from 25 percent to 32 percent despite torrential rains affecting road networks experienced from June to October in the country. In 2020, all districts are expected to fully transition from campaign approach to routine services. Overall national VAS coverage among children 6 to 59 months in Semester 1 through campaign and routine service was 70 percent. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
